p.s: The play Disgraced, Scene 3 by Ayad Akhtar in general discusses society problems and issues like racism and identity crisis.

It's located in Manhattan (New York) and the main characters are Amir, who is a man from Pakistan with muslimicMuslim background, his wife Emily, Isaac, who's a working partner of Emily and his wife Jory, who works with Amir.
In this third scene (p. 71, l. 15-74, l. 15) they all meet for dinner party at Amir's and Emily's appartmentapartment.
The atmosphere is already tense because they talked about politics, racism and their personal experiences with it.
But they are all very different characters with contradictory opinions.
Amir and Emily go for a walk to talk about their job at the law firm, where they work as partners.
There is a project, that both want to work on but Jory gets the offer.
So Amir gets mad at her because he thinks he would do it better and works harder for it.
When Jory and Amir come back to the appartmentapartment, Jory sees Emily and Isaac kissing.
She first stays calm and asks if they have an affair.
Emilytrystries to explain the situation by saying that she was upset that Amir didn't get the partnership at the firm and Isaac comforted her.
Amir comes in and is still mad at Jory.
He thinks it is all her fault that he didn't get the job and that she wants to destroy his marriage with Emily.
He offends Jory but then Isaac gets between them.
They get into a fight and Amir spits in IsaacsIsaac's face before he (Isaac) leaves with Jory.
Emily is shocked about Amir's behaviour but she pretends that everything is okay and she hasn't done something wrong.
She doesn't want to talk about the kiss and the situation between her and Isaac till Amir asks her if she is sleeping with him.
She trystries to explain herself again but now admits that she did.
Just before she can end her excuse, Amir beats her agressivlyaggressively in her face many times until she bloods.
Amir realizes what he just did after that.
In this scene the situation escalates and you see how every character handles the situation and conflict differently.
Amir reacts very aggressive and instinctive, while his wife trystries to explain everything and stays more calm and clear.
